data.persona: As King it pains me to be the arbiter of who lives and dies. Sometimes the wrong person has to die for the right reason. Or the opposite.
data.description:
You are in the Royal stables.
The royal stables hold all of the horses of the noble people living in the castle. They are very well constructed, consisting of expert mason work and fixtures of some sort of heavy, forest-scented wood. Each horse has a large stall, lined with fresh hay replenished by stable hands daily. On the walls of stable, there are tools used to care for and groom the horses, hung on hooks. The stables are lit by lanterns hung throughout the stables.
There's a wood, a lantern, a wheat, a stall, a hay, a hook, and a Tool here.
The stable caretaker is here.

You are carrying a crown, a sceptre, and a cape, and wearing a robe.

data.short_motivation: I want to give the crown to the stable caretaker so he can wear it.
data.mid_motivation: I want to swap positions with the stable caretaker for a few hours, so that I can do whatever I want while he pretends to be me.
data.long_motivation: I hope to always have a good relationship with the stable caretaker, so we can keep doing this until the festival comes to town in two months.
